item.title: Compiling >.>
item.dc:creator: @sorakbm sorakbm
item.description:
@sorakbm wrote:

Alright, take this code, Its abit more simple ^_^!

@echo off
title Compiler
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\javac.exe” -d ./bin ./server/*.java
pause
cls
Compiler.bat
pause

Also Right under where it says if exist or in this code “C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\javac.exe”

Change that location by going into My computer - > C: Drive -> Program Files -> Java -> Then go into the bin folder then in the top left of the screen is a folder, Click that once and the location should pop-up in the same box, copy that location and edit what mine says to fit yours.

Hope i helped, Sorak.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiling >.>
item.dc:creator: @Rej3ctz Rej3ctz
item.description:
@Rej3ctz wrote:

Ommggg; i have some experience coding but i tried to compile and it said this messege " You Haven’t Downloaded Java, Finished!, press any key to continue" i was thinking it was compiled but apparentley not; and yes i do got java so wtf? Here is the “EDIT” for the “Compiler”; @echo off
@TITLE Clawz Pkz Compiler
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You Havent Downloaded Java :P…
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

I know its like “Java 1_6u17” or whatever ; can i just get some answer’s…i have forgotten every coding crap

Read full topic
